SEARCH
Module com.javarepowizards.portfoliomanager
Package com.javarepowizards.portfoliomanager.dao

Interface IPortfolioDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
PortfolioDAO
public interface IPortfolioDAO
Interface for portfolio data access operations. Defines methods to manipulate user portfolio holdings and balances. Supports both reading and updating data in persistent or in-memory storage.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • getHoldings

      List<PortfolioEntry> getHoldings()
      Gets the holdings for the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      List of PortfolioEntry objects

    • getAvailableBalance

      double getAvailableBalance()
      Gets the available cash balance for the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The available balance as a double

    • addToHoldings

      void addToHoldings(PortfolioEntry entry)
      Adds a new holding or updates existing one for the user.
      Parameters:
      entry - The portfolio entry to be added or updated

    • getTotalPortfolioValue

      double getTotalPortfolioValue()
      Calculates the total value of the user's portfolio.
      Returns:
      Total portfolio value including holdings and cash

    • upsertHolding

      void upsertHolding(int userId, StockName stock, int quantity, double totalValue)
      Inserts or updates a specific stock holding.
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the user
      stock - Stock name
      quantity - Quantity to add
      totalValue - Total market value of the added quantity

    • getHoldingsForUser

      List<PortfolioEntry> getHoldingsForUser(int userId) throws SQLException
      Gets all holdings for a specified user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the user
      Returns:
      List of PortfolioEntry records
      Throws:
      SQLException - if retrieval fails

    • sellHolding

      void sellHolding(int userId, StockName stock) throws SQLException
      Sells a specific stock holding for the user.
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the user
      stock - Stock to be sold
      Throws:
      SQLException - if sell operation fails

    • deductFromBalance

      void deductFromBalance(int userId, double amount) throws SQLException
      Deducts a specific amount from the user's available balance.
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the user
      amount - Amount to deduct
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the update fails
